Characteristic.name: RSC Measurement

InformativeText.Summary: The RSC Measurement characteristic (RSC refers to Running Speed and Cadence) is a variable length structure containing a Flags field, an Instantaneous Speed field and an Instantaneous Cadence field and, based on the contents of the Flags field, may contain a Stride Length field and a Total Distance field.

Field.name: Flags
Field.InformativeText: These flags define which data fields are present in the Characteristic value.

Field.name: Instantaneous Speed
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in m/s with a resolution of 1/256 s

Field.name: Instantaneous Cadence
Field.InformativeText: Unit is in 1/minute (or RPM) with a resolutions of 1 1/min (or 1 RPM)

InformativeText.p: C1: Field exists if the key of bit 0 of the Flags field is set to 1.
- Unit is in meter with a resolution of 1/100 m (or centimeter).
C2: Field exists if the key of bit 1 of the Flags field is set to 1.
- Unit is in meter with a resolution of 1/10 m (or decimeter).

Characteristic.Note: The fields in the above table are in the order of LSO to MSO. Where LSO = Least Significant Octet and MSO = Most Significant Octet.
